intro: Cecropia congesta, commonly known as the clustered cecropia, is a fast-growing, evergreen tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant has a distinctive, hollow stem with a network of aerial roots that help it climb and support its rapid growth. It plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various animals. Cecropia congesta is also used in traditional medicine and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
